attributes.action: Allow Walid Durani to stay permanently in the UK.
attributes.background: In 2012 Walid fled Afghanistan to the UK after his Grandfather was beheaded.  Walid was threatened with the same fate.  Since then he has been educated and completed an apprenticeship here. He was Highly Commended at the Youth Build UK awards that took place in Parliament in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
At the age of 18 the UK Government said he should be sent back to Kabul, Afghanistan. Walid has no family or support in Afghanistan and his life will certainly be danger. Kabul is an extremely dangerous place with the Foreign Office currently advising against all but essential travel & in some areas they advise against all travel.
His story has been covered by the BBC,various radio stations & newspapers.
Please help us support Walid by signing this petition. Follow us on facebook - Support Walid

attributes.action: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren)
attributes.background: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren) if the mother is forced to flee domestic abuse whilst she is pregnant or whilst the child is too young to choose for themselves.
attributes.additional_details: Abusive ex partners also use children as a gateway back into their victims life. Safeguarding restrictions being put in place is not sufficient. If the child has contact with the abusive parent, they are very likely to be exposed to domestic abuse when observing the parent in future relationships. This can be damaging and is not in a child's best interest. The abuser may also abuse the child or use the child to indirectly continue to abuse their ex partner.

attributes.action: Agree to change the law to tag all potential terrorists.
attributes.background: Currently it takes 20 agents to follow 1 terrorist suspect. If there are 300 or 5000 or 20000 people of interest in our communities, our agents have to prioritise who to follow, clearly leaving potential huge risks to the British population of more attacks (5 successful attacks since March).
attributes.additional_details: The ordinary British public have had a enough of wishy washy handling of these attacks being told to carry on as normal. How can we? We need to see some action which provides this nation with security. If you can’t intern them due to political correctness then tag them.

attributes.action: Include cycle paths in post-Brexit farming subsidies
attributes.background: Rewarding farmers for providing cycle paths across farmland, would offer safe routes to schools and work, connecting villages and towns. This would reduce pollution, provide leisure opportunities, compensate for lost bus services and contribute to the well being of the nation.

attributes.action: the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards" to British citizens
attributes.background: Many British citizens, while staying in other European countries, risk being fined for failing to carry a national identity card or passport, because the British passport is insufficiently small or durable to carry at all times. Therefore the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards".

attributes.action: Urge the Bank of England to stop using animal products in their bank notes
attributes.background:
The new 5 and 10 pound notes distributed contain animal product Tallow.

Tallow is a hard, fatty substance made from rendered animal fat, which is commonly used to make soap and candles.
attributes.additional_details:
As vegans, vegetarians, muslims, Hindus and people of planet earth, please sign!! This beyond ricidlous we have to stop using animals as an alternative to plastic or paper!! We can go noteless!!

The new polymer notes use beef tallow made from suet, which is hard fat found around an animal’s kidneys, stomach and other organs.

attributes.action: Go back to the old GCSEs and abolish the new 9-1 Grading system
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are incredibly difficult and it results in many students failing or getting low grades. The new system has set students for failure and has even increased the difficulty to that of the old A-levels. This is inconsiderate and unjust. We must abolish this system.

attributes.action: Reduce the price of British citizenship for children from £973 to less than £600
attributes.background: The price for British citizenship for children is currently £973, and without this they can't vote or claim student loans. The Home Office makes over £500 profit for each application and this makes many families unable to afford citizenship. The government are putting a price on democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
These children will, later in life, pay taxes as a normal citizen would, but will not benefit in the same way.

As well as this, over 3,000 children that do apply, are denied the citizenship and not refunded the £973 fee.

The right to these has been given to these children by parliament, but currently they are being sold by the home office.

To find out more about the issue, you can read this article:

https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/534zx8/the-british-born-kids-who-cant-afford-to-be-british

attributes.action: Stop plans for Bradwell Nuclear Plant
attributes.background: This area is perfect for renewal energy, wind farms, solar.  Nuclear is totally unnecessary. Renewable energy is the way forward if designed to be used by the UK and not sold off.

attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look into the funding model and use of the NHS
attributes.background: The funding model of the NHS has been a political football for decades, yet it is perhaps the more fundamental of services. Its funding is too important to be decided by the conflicting interests of political parties. It's use needs to be examined to decide whether its current use is sustainable

attributes.action: charge people who need an ambulance or hospital care due to excessive drinking.
attributes.background:
Hospital admissions – narrow measure
There were 339 thousand estimated admissions related to alcohol consumption in 2015/16. This is 3% higher than 2014/15 and 22% higher than 2005/06.
This represents 2.1% of all hospital admissions which has changed little in the last 10 years.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS resorses would be better spent on people who really need it rather than self inflicted drunkenness. How may people have died as a result of an ambulance or hospital bed not being available because of irresponsible people excessively drinking.
If people can afford to get drunk they can afford the cost of recovering from it.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for drivers to hit and run when hitting a domestic animal
attributes.background: This point needs to be put into action because domesticated animals being killed with no justice is no option and should be a criminal offence. When an animal companion is removed it leaves people feeling very alone and broken, looking for justice that currently can’t be served - personal experience

attributes.action: Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%
attributes.background: We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards. As a company they are awful they don’t care about the customer they care about profits. Let’s get TransPennine operating the northern lines

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to leave dogs chained up outside for hours on end.
attributes.background: Imagine being chained up, especially in extreme weather conditions such as hot sun, rain and freezing temperatures. It's not the way you would treat a human being, so why do people treat dogs like this? They need the basic needs like food, warmth, shelter and love.
attributes.additional_details: I have grown up with dogs all my life, most of them rescued from homes that don't care for them properly or they're surplus to requirement. In Pennsylvania, USA, they have just passed "Libre's Law", which prosecutes owners for leaving their dogs chained outside under certain conditions. For more information: http://www.philly.com/philly/news/animal-cruelty-pennsylvania-libres-law-20170628.html?mobi=true

attributes.action: Make broadcasters have content warnings and signpost support for mental illness
attributes.background: While some depictions of people's battles with mental illness in the media can oftentimes be accurate representations and this should be applauded it should also be done safely taking potential risks to the viewer/listener into account by offering warnings before the programme and signposting after.
attributes.additional_details:
Great strides have been made by some TV broadcasters to raise awareness of mental illness by depicting it so accurately, and some broadcasters exemplify how such a sensitive topic should be handled.

However I have noticed how web-based broadcasters offer no warnings of content and offer no signposting after the programme. 

This is potentially dangerous and I feel strongly that people who are vulnerable should be able to enjoy these programmes but know where to find help if needed afterwards.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of dogs in pet shops and introduce stricter licensing requirements.
attributes.background: Puppy farms breed masses of dogs for profit with little regard for their welfare. Many dogs in pet shops come from these puppy farms, so by banning their sale it will help drive them out of business.
attributes.additional_details: The legal limit of litters per bitch should also be lowered from six to four, to protect the health of the mother. It should be mandatory for the buyer of a puppy to first see the dog at home with its mother. This should crack down on the reselling of dogs through a third party.

attributes.action: Lower the abortion time frame from 24 weeks to 23 weeks.
attributes.background: The 23-week survival rate in England and Wales was 23 per cent in 2010, and in 2014, the latest year for which data is available, 33 per cent of babies born at 23 weeks reached their first birthday. The figure is continuously rising due to medical advances.

attributes.action: Stop hospitals from charging blue badge holders parking in hospitals
attributes.background: As if people with disabilities don't have enough to worry about without some hospitals now charging them to park. People on disability are an easy target and often have to visit hospitals frequently through no fault of their own and to start charging them to park is a disgrace.
attributes.additional_details: We need to put an end to this and support the disabled not punish them for their disability. This can only be seen as greed and it needs to be sorted out now.

attributes.action: Waive the two child cap on tax credits for mothers working minimum 18 hours/week
attributes.background: After April 2017, no woman will be able to claim or receive any Tax credits for a third child, unless the child is born as a multiple birth or conceived as a result of a sexual assault. This approach is callous, as well as ignorant, as many women live with men that force them to get pregnant.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government deems third babies a luxury not every family has earned, though the royal’s third baby will be taken care of, courtesy of the TAXPAYER (who's being penalised the same as those who do not work at all).
As long as a woman is in paid work, she should be able to receive tax credit support.
For each child conceived, I believe 6 hours of work is ideal - e.g: 18 hours for 3 children, 24 hours for 4 children, 30 hours for 5 children.
A cap on 5 children (with the exception of one multiple birth of twins) is fair.
If a working mother falls ill or disabled as an unforseeable result, I believe her claim for tax credits should continue. However, a cap should be placed on any children following her illness, unless she is able to return back to work.

attributes.action: Make access to food, clothes and shelter a human right, enshrined in law.
attributes.background: Poverty is a very real phenomonon for many in the UK today and the inequality gap between the rich and the poor continues to widen. Lets underline the boundaries of our civilisation. Too many people will sleep in the street this winter. Lets end homelessness and hunger in the UK, 1 meal at a time.
attributes.additional_details: I am a citizen, with a voice and a computer.  I just can't continue to pass the increasing number of people on the street and try to give them change for a cup of tea without recognising that the problem needs to be tackled strategically/politically.  I also worked as a health visitor and saw first hand how many families don,t have consistent access to meals.  The problem is huge and needs a strategic response at a national level.  Food, clothes and shelter for all is not too much to ask.

attributes.action: End free movement of pets to UK to prevent parasite blinding people and pets.
attributes.background: The pet passport scheme allows EU pets to pass through borders without quarantine allowing the spread of an oriental eye worm that blinds both animals and people. We must quarantine travelling animals and treat them if infected. Infections in humans have been reported throughout mainland Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/oriental-eye-worm-infection-dogs-blindness-spread-uk-thelazia-callipaeda-a7955711.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-4901936/UK-pets-owners-risk-blinding-eye-infection.html

attributes.action: Raise the issue of using big cats as photo props with the Thai goverment
attributes.background:
Recently, tigers and lions have become the centre of a cruel and barbaric attraction. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists and celebrities.

However, these animals are drugged up and live in vile conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has worked hard at ending animal cruelty and continues to do so. However, much of Thailand is only just recognising the concept of animal welfare. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists.

However, the truth behind these 'tiger selfies' is a sad and heart-breaking scene. The animals are drugged to ensure they are 'safe' to have selfies with. Furthermore, the conditions in which they are kept are cramped and filthy.

attributes.action: The Government must intervene in the proposed GKN takeover
attributes.background: GKN is one of the last bastions of UK high-tech engineering, involved with automotive and defence contracts. Selling would be a threat to national security and, more importantly jobs! Protect our jobs and our future NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May comes under mounting pressure to block the takeover of British engineering firm GKN
GKN is fighting off an unwanted £7.4billion bid from Melrose
Melrose said it wants to sell the company within three to five years for a profit
It is feared this would see GKN broken up and its parts sold across the world, harming UK industry and defence 


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5398175/Theresa-comes-pressure-block-takeover-GKN.html#ixzz57GyAFQSr

attributes.action: Make Government spending transparent, adjust funding "increases" for inflation
attributes.background: Often funding increases are announced, which amount to a funding cut after inflation. The only transparent approach is to deflate figures for inflation to give an increase figure in "real terms".
attributes.additional_details:
Full Fact provides evidence that the Grant review for police funding amounts to a cut after inflation.
https://fullfact.org/crime/police-funding-england-and-wales/

Conservatives say Labour voted against an increase.
https://www.facebook.com/conservatives/photos/a.288165009278.146725.8807334278/10155780194029279/?type=3&theater

Labour say Conservatives voted for a real terms cut.
https://www.facebook.com/labourparty/posts/10155283147077411

attributes.action: Introduce new opportunities for medically failing applicants for the military.
attributes.background: Applicants who have applied and had their heart set on starting a military career with the correct attitude, fitness and skills who are turned away for, in some cases, minor or none apparent disabilities or injuries should be given more opportunities or choices.
attributes.additional_details: The modern military is diverse and equal such as allowing women to fight on the front lines but the the fact that you may not be allowed to serve on the front lines or for your country in any role due to a predicted adherent or minor issue has affected the majority of applying citizens. I understand that the military is required to uphold certain standards and a minimum level of fitness, qualities and skills from it's personnel depending on the various roles. However, when a potential candidate is not given the chance to prove their usefulness, or given any chance of finding their place in the military things need to changed or at the very least looked into.

attributes.action: Pressure the Cameroon government to organise a referendum in Southern Cameroons.
attributes.background: Southern Cameroon was a Trust territory of the UK with its mandate ending in 1961 where a Plebiscite was organised by the UN giving the people the option of either joining Cameroon/Nigeria to gain its independence.The present crisis in the region is a direct consequence of the failure that process
attributes.additional_details:
Britain has a key role to play in the present crisis in Southern Cameroons.On 1st October 2017 Southern Cameroons reasserted its independence from Cameroun. It now has an interim government and now recognizes itself as the Republic of Ambazonia.

The problem in Southern Cameroons is a consequence of failed decolonisation.UN resolution 1514 reaffirms the right of every people to self determination.Denial of that right or subjugation of a people to an alien power is a frequent cause of conflict.

attributes.action: Increase the hourly funding rate for Early Years Education
attributes.background:
Early Years Funding is in Crisis!

National Living Wage is increasing by 4.4% in April.  Employer pension contributions are increasing to 2% at the same time.
Guess how much our funding has gone up by?
0%

Early years providers are closing, please sign and save FREE Early Years Education!
attributes.additional_details:
We have to sign a contract stating it is ILLEGAL for us to get parents to pay top ups to cover the short fall in funding.  Not that they should of course, as the government advertise it as FREE childcare after all!

No other business has what it can charge their customers dictated to them.  The government control what we receive and what we can charge and the result is a deficit for most providers.

Please help is get an increase in funding, in line with the increase of business costs.

attributes.action: Stop the care cuts! We’re now behind Crisis point! We’re at the edge!
attributes.background: Residential care homes are closing at an unprecedented rate, hospitals are logjammed with elderly patients with nowhere to go; in the community, local authority cuts are leaving more than a million people desperately in need of more assistance in their homes.
attributes.additional_details: From a 19 year old girl that started care at the age of 18 I’m begging for you not to do any more cuts Every single year we face more and more difficulties proving quality care for the elderly and disabled, do you not realise how much pressure we are under? These people have seen more than you ever will have. In 40 years time when we’re old and frail WHO WILL HELP US? Who will be our support! please think about the long term effect this will have on people!

attributes.action: Fund the costs spent by the emergency services following the Manchester attack.
attributes.background: We call on the Government to honour its commitment to fully fund the costs spent by the emergency services and local authorities following the horrific Manchester attack.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks after 5th November.
attributes.background:
I appreciate that Bonfire Night is going to be celebrated each and every year with fireworks, without fail. However, a lot of people and animals become extremely distressed during this time. 
Fireworks going on for weeks after Bonfire Night is completely unnecessary.

attributes.action: Ban overseas investment in UK property
attributes.background: The UK / London has been experiencing large scale foreign investment in the UK residential housing market. Foreign investment is endemic causing overpriced properties to be built, sold or left empty etc.
attributes.additional_details: Research carried out by the BBC into investors from the Russian Federation, China, Hong Kong, Africa etc. shows buying property in the UK has reached epidemic proportions. Housing bought by non-UK residents could be used as a bank or to hide money (laundering). Wholesale, buying off plan of entire blocks of flats or buildings is causing the UK housing market to spiral out of control. The UK Government should adopt the New Zealand policy of banning non NZ residents from buying propriety.

attributes.action: Update the driving licence point system from 12 points to at least 15-20
attributes.background: The points system was introduced in 1988 which is nearly 30 years ago. There are so many things you can get points for these days that were not about then. All I'm asking is for the people that are at say one more defective tyre or something away from an automatic ban because of the tot up.
attributes.additional_details: It should still be an instant ban for drink, drug driving. There are more and more ways now to get points than there was when this was introduced.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from riding two abreast.
attributes.background: Driving through the Yorkshire Dales is quite a frustrating experience - driving behind 20 cyclists for miles with about 50 cars trying to pass. Impossible.

attributes.action: Ban the sale, and use of any tool designed to cause pain/fear in training dogs.
attributes.background:
After the successful banning of the shock collar - let's get tools that are inherently designed to cause pain or fear banned too. This includes but not limited to choke/prong/pinch/spray collars/devices.

There is NO place in using pain or fear to train any dog whether a pet or working.

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive the 30 hours funding for childcare
attributes.background: Student nurses don't get enough money to cover childcare costs. The 30 hours funding is only available to people who earn 120pw but it is not fair that student nurses have to work 37.5 hours at placement then work 2 days to meet this criteria

attributes.action: The People's Mandate. Electorate vote on the agenda of next parliament.
attributes.background: Give the electorate a preliminary vote in the year before each General Election, that will allow them to choose the agenda of the next parliament & provide the political parties with a 'people's mandate' by which they design their manifestos to serve. For too long the word 'Mandate' has been abused.
attributes.additional_details: This 'Preliminary Vote' could be in the form of a list of government departments or pressing issues that the country faces. The electorate would vote on their top 3 priorities and this would be collated to provide the future government with a democratic mandate from which to form their manifestos. To date, the people get what they are given. With a preliminary vote on issues of importance the people get to be more involved in driving the political policy of the next parliament.

attributes.action: Stop pharmacies from throwing away unused drugs returned when no longer required
attributes.background: When a patient has no further use for prescribed drugs, we are encouraged to return them to a pharmacy. However, current practice is to destroy the drugs, even when it can easily be confirmed whether or not the drugs have already been opened. This wasteful practice should end, saving the NHS money.

attributes.action: Invest more money in youth charities and youth service providers in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a profound reduction in services for young people resulting from funding cuts. With huge pressures on all local authority budgets, these cuts won’t be reversed. We have to support the organisations who help young people from areas with high levels of deprivation and low income backgrounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2012, in London alone at least £22 million has been cut from council youth service budgets and 12,700 places for young people have been lost. The average council has cut its youth service budget by nearly £1 million, an average of 36%. (London's Lost Youth Services, 2017).

Across the country more than 1 in 10 think their life will amount to nothing, no matter how hard they try. 42% of young people feel traditional goals like getting a steady job are unrealistic (Prince's Trust, 2017).

attributes.action: Offer legal aid for all women/ men who have been a victim of domestic abuse
attributes.background: Legal aid is not currently available to all domestic abuse survivors. There are very specific conditions you must meet to be valid, which does not take into consideration any financial abuse or manipulation, which has left a lot of victims struggling to pay off debt and get divorced at the same time

attributes.action: Divert the money used for foreign aid to fund the NHS as a temporary measure.
attributes.background:
Diverting overseas aid may seem wrong but we have many UK citizens of many ethnic backgrounds who are suffering because of lack of funding to the NHS and many of our citizens are dying needlessly.
The aid funding can be restored once we have put the NHS back on a proper footing.

attributes.action: Give the money we will spend making UK passports blue to the NHS
attributes.background: Blue passports are little more than a hidden cost of Brexit and a vanity project. No one either for or against Brexit could possibly believe that the colour of our passports is more important than the health of society.

attributes.action: Any NEWSPAPER to be bound like BBC: to be fair, balanced, truthful and accurate.
attributes.background: At top of cover page, all publications to declare themselves to be a Newspaper, or Propaganda Sheet, Party Political publication, Advertising material, Lifestyle magazine, Specific Interest Publication. We need to know what we buy, just as we differentiate between reportage and advertisement.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this need is the existence of daily publications which:
•	deliberately distort their reporting by selection of facts, 
•	selectively headline items with a disproportionate emphasis on some topics, 
•	repeat items as if they were new or current when they are not, 
•	use biased, inflammatory or pejorative language, 
•	set a tone which encourages divisiveness and prejudice against particular groups or beliefs.
This is a serious and growing problem, today and in recent years.

attributes.action: Change the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p and replace with bags for life
attributes.background: The introduction of the 5p bag charge in 2015 reduced usage in England by 85% but there is still work to be done to minimise our negative impact on the environment, especially marine life. An increase would raise more money for charities and replacing single use with bags for life will reduce waste.
attributes.additional_details:
A ten week trial by Tesco to stop selling single use 5p carrier bags and offering 10p reusable bags for life recently saw a 25% reduction in bag sales as shoppers either brought their own or purchased the more expensive bag (made from 94% recyclable material). 

This move will help fewer bags needing to be sent to landfill while continuing to generate money from bag sales that goes directly to environmental charities.

attributes.action: Make all referendums require 60% of the vote to effect a change
attributes.background: We vote for M.P.s to make decisions on our behalf. They have the time to research and debate issues appropriately. When major decisions are handed over to the population, there is a significant risk of voting being based on  emotional or personal rather than objective reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
There is (as seems to have been the case in the USA and the UK recently) much greater risk of external agencies inappropriately influencing the vote.  And those agencies\individuals who have greater financial resources (and probably lobbying interests) can also unfairly influence the voting patterns.
A 60% majority would to some extent indicate a genuine ground swell of opinion towards the change.

attributes.action: Prevent the MOD from cutting Operational Allowance for our Armed Forces
attributes.background: Operational Allowance has compensated our Armed Forces for the additional dangers of serving in countries like Afghanistan and Iraq. The MOD is considering cutting this allowance. This will have a huge impact upon morale of those deploying or about to deploy and their families, and must be stopped.

attributes.action: Limit motorway road works to 1 junction at a time.
attributes.background: With the current influx of “smart” motorways being installed around the country, we have seen neverending roadworks for miles and miles. The current spate of roadworks on the M6 between Jncs 19 and 16 are causing mayhem and misery daily. Accidents occur daily and yet work won’t be done till 2019
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing the government stop Highways England from installing road works for more than one junction at a time. Where the next junction is longer than 5 miles away then the limit be 5 miles. The lanes are too narrow and the lack of a hard shoulder in the inevitable outcome of an incident impedes emergency services and creates hours of tail backs. All to help protect workers which is all well and good if they were actually working on that stretch.

attributes.action: Action an effective NHS care pathway for patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is an inherited connective tissue abnormality.People with EDS have no care within the NHS. Healthcarer's have no access to formal training, forcing patients to self fund private care with the few specialists available, in order to manage their multiple,painful & life threatening disabilities.
attributes.additional_details:
EDS UK and the Royal College of GP's are working together to improve education on EDS and to create a 'toolkit' for GP's managing patients with the condition. (https://www.ehlers-danlos.org/news/spotlight/). 

At present, patients like myself are forced to fundraise for urgent and long term care to manage disabilities, extreme pain, dislocations, and at times life saving surgeries abroad. No specialist area has claimed the condition leaving GP's unaware of who to refer patients to for their care

attributes.action: New drivers to have black box with continuous speeding reported to the police
attributes.background: Most new drivers today think they are invincible on the roads. All black boxes do at the moment is record excessive speeding to the car insurance companies that use them. Why are these behaviours not reported to the police and why are drivers not punished for this behaviour?
attributes.additional_details: It should be mandatory that all new drivers have a black box for their first year of driving, with all continuous excessive speeding data sent to the police. Police should deal with this behaviour the same as if they caught the driver themselves, via a driving awareness course or points. Black boxes shouldn’t be limited to just cars either, they should be on all road legal transportation. This could not only potentially save lives, but save money on insurance in the long run too.

attributes.action: Mandatory for all alcoholic beverages to display nutritional information
attributes.background: I suffer with type 1 diabetes but want to lead a normal life. Identifying the total carbohydrate content of a beer from various internet searches is difficult and unreliable. Furthmore we have a nation of growing waistbands, shouldn't the calorific content of alcohol be visible to inform consumers?

attributes.action: Make councils set up payment plans for parking tickets instead of total payment
attributes.background: Make it so councils have to let people pay fines in installmemts for people who can’t afford to pay in a lump sum for parking tickets. Instead of passing it to private bailiff firms who add more costs and won’t accept an affordable payment plan until their fees have been added on.
attributes.additional_details: I had a parking ticket which I couldn’t pay in a lump sum.  The council wouldn’t let me pay in installmemts so it got passed to the bailiffs and more charges put on. Then they came and clamped my van I use for self employed work and removed it after they were told it was for my business and valued under £1350. I have a 7 year old child who I can not get to school anymore and I have no income now and have complained and appealed but still no van. I made payments but they wanted £80 a month.
